entry.title: FREEZING RAIN WARNING , St. John's
entry.summary: Persons in or near this area should be on the lookout for adverse weather conditions and take necessary safety precautions. Issued: 3:53 PM NST Friday 17 February 2023

entry.title: Current Conditions: Cloudy, 0.5°C
entry.summary:
Observed at: St. John's Int'l Airport 7:30 PM NST Friday 17 February 2023
Condition: Cloudy
Temperature: 0.5°C
Pressure / Tendency: 100.4 kPa falling
Visibility: 24.1 km
Humidity: 76 %
Dewpoint: -3.2°C
Wind: E 10 km/h
Air Quality Health Index: 3

entry.title: Friday night: Rain mixed with freezing rain. Low minus 2.
entry.summary: Cloudy. Flurries beginning early this evening then changing to rain or freezing rain later this evening and then changing to freezing rain after midnight. Rainfall amount 5 mm. Wind becoming northeast 30 km/h gusting to 50 overnight. Low minus 2. Wind chill minus 9 overnight. Forecast issued 4:00 PM NST Friday 17 February 2023

entry.title: Saturday: Snow at times heavy or ice pellets. Temperature falling to minus 5 in the afternoon.
entry.summary: Freezing rain changing to ice pellets in the morning then to snow at times heavy near noon. Blowing snow over exposed areas in the afternoon. Snow and ice pellet amount 10 cm. Wind north 30 km/h gusting to 60. Temperature falling to minus 5 in the afternoon. Wind chill near minus 13. UV index 1 or low. Forecast issued 4:00 PM NST Friday 17 February 2023

entry.title: Saturday night: Snow. Low minus 11.
entry.summary: Snow ending in the evening then partly cloudy. Blowing snow over exposed areas early in the evening. Amount 2 cm. Wind north 30 km/h gusting to 60 becoming northwest 20 after midnight. Low minus 11. Wind chill minus 13 in the evening and minus 19 overnight. Forecast issued 4:00 PM NST Friday 17 February 2023

entry.title: Sunday: Chance of flurries. High minus 3. POP 40%
entry.summary: A mix of sun and cloud with 40 percent chance of flurries. High minus 3. Forecast issued 4:00 PM NST Friday 17 February 2023
